sweetener noun
(PERSUADE)
[ C ] something that you give to someone in order to persuade him or her to do something: The tax bill includes sweeteners for both parties, so it looks likely to pass.
[ C ] mainly UK a present or money given to persuade someone to do something, especially in a way that is secret and often dishonest: a financial sweetener
